entries.title: U.S. Courts India as Technology Partner to Counter China
entries.description: American and Indian officials are working toward new partnerships in defense technology, advanced telecom and semiconductors.

entries.title: Pakistan Grapples with Terrorist Attack That Left 101 Dead
entries.description: The attack raised fears of a new wave of militancy from the Pakistani Taliban and sparked a heated debate over the government’s ability to meet that threat amid an economic and political crisis.

entries.title: Netanyahu Juggles Competing Goals Over Palestinian Attacks
entries.description: After a deadly week, Benjamin Netanyahu faces domestic calls for a harsh crackdown, and international pressure to moderate. It’s a familiar balancing act — but with one major difference.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China Rebounds
entries.description: Also, Russia’s resilient economy and Sri Lanka’s enduring struggle.

entries.title: Brexit Turns 3. Why Is No One Wearing a Party Hat?
entries.description: The divorce between Britain and the European Union has become the dark thread that, to many, explains why Britain is suffering more than its neighbors.

entries.title: Support for Tunisian President Slipping After Parliament Vote
entries.description: Turnout was meager in two rounds of voting for a Parliament stripped of much of its power, with most political parties barred from the elections.

entries.title: U.S. Says Russia Fails to Comply With START, a Nuclear Arms Treaty
entries.description: The United States says Russia is not allowing American inspectors access to its arsenal to ensure compliance with the New START Treaty, which the two nations renewed in 2021.

entries.title: In Photos: Pope Francis Visits Africa
entries.description: The first pope to visit Africa in almost four decades began in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where the struggles of daily life are the very problems Francis has sought to highlight.

entries.title: Wagner Group May Have Committed War Crimes in Mali, UN Experts Say
entries.description: Persistent reports point to “horrific executions” and other atrocities possibly committed by the Kremlin-affiliated mercenary force and the Malian military, according to human rights experts.

entries.title: Iran and Russia Move Toward Linking Their Banking Systems
entries.description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia had long been cautious  about deepening ties to Iran, but his calculus has changed during the course of the war.

entries.title: Pope Francis Lands in Congo, Where All His Priorities Converge
entries.description: The Central African country is wracked by war, poverty and environmental plunder — and it may be the future of the Catholic Church.

entries.title: Why the French Are Protesting Macron’s Pension Overhaul, Again
entries.description: President Emmanuel Macron is forging ahead with plans to raise the legal age of retirement to 64, from 62, despite strikes, street demonstrations and a looming parliamentary battle.

entries.title: China’s Covid Tsunami Recedes, Bringing Relief, Grief and Anxiety
entries.description: Officials say an onslaught of infections has slowed, and many people seem eager to move on. But fresh flare-ups could bring more illness and deaths.

entries.title: Sri Lanka Is Calm Again. That Doesn’t Mean Things Are Any Better.
entries.description: After an economic collapse and political upheaval, Sri Lankans have become resigned to leaner meals and reduced horizons.

entries.title: An Underused Covid Treatment
entries.description: Doctors are now a major barrier to Paxlovid.

entries.title: Russia and Ukraine Locked in ‘Very Tough’ Battle for Bakhmut
entries.description: Moscow is pouring in waves of fighters and targeting Ukrainian supply lines in an effort to gain its first significant battlefield victory in months.

entries.title: Blinken Heads to West Bank After Surge in Violence
entries.description: After meeting Israeli officials in Jerusalem, the U.S. secretary of state will meet the Palestinian leadership in Ramallah amid a sharp rise in tensions in the region.

entries.title: Ukraine Redoubles Its Efforts to Obtain Fighter Jets
entries.description: Ukraine’s allies have supplied Kyiv with an ever-growing list of weaponry, but many countries are wary of its recent requests for military jets.

entries.title: Russia Sidesteps Western Punishments, With Help From Friends
entries.description: A surge in trade by Russia’s neighbors and allies hints at one reason its economy remains so resilient after sweeping sanctions.

entries.title: Pope Francis Visits Congo: What to Know
entries.description: The pope is planning to spend three days in the Democratic Republic of Congo, one of the most populous and most Catholic nations in Africa. While it has extensive natural riches, its people have long been buffeted by conflict and exploitation.

entries.title: Russia’s economic growth suggests Western sanctions are having a limited impact.
BBC Arabic Radio Airs Final Broadcast After 85 Years
entries.description: The move came as part of cost-cutting measures under which the news service is also ending its radio programming in 10 other languages, including Persian, Chinese and Hindi.

entries.title: Blinken Heads to West Bank After Surge in Violence
entries.description: After meeting Israeli officials in Jerusalem, the U.S. secretary of state will meet the Palestinian leadership in Ramallah amid a sharp rise in tensions in the region.

entries.title: The Last Boeing 747 Leaves the Factory
entries.description: The plane known as “Queen of the Skies” helped make air travel more affordable, but it has been supplanted by smaller, more efficient aircraft.

entries.title: A Risky Trade in Ukraine Grows Riskier Amid the War
entries.description: Russia’s invasion has disrupted the social services that help reduce harm to the women and men who sell sex, threatening public health.

entries.title: I.M.F. Upgrades Global Outlook as Inflation Eases
entries.description: The International Monetary Fund said the world economy was poised for a rebound as inflation eases.

entries.title: Ukraine Urges Allies to Speed Up Delivery of Weaponry
entries.description: “We have to make time our weapon,” President Volodymyr Zelensky declared as Ukrainians girded for an expected Russian offensive.
